discussion.content:
that is correct
When you activate the port security feature, the auto-learn option is also automatically enabled. You
can choose to activate the port-security feature and disable auto-learn using the port-security activate
vsan number no-auto-learn command.

choices.B: Disable auto learn in VSAN 1 with the no port-security auto-learn vsan 1 command
choices.C: Disable CFS distribution with the no port-security distribute vsan 1 command
choices.D: Commit the changes with the port-security commit copy vsan 1 command
choices.A: Commit the active database with the port-security database copy vsan 1 command

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer must strictly enforce the port security configuration database in the Fibre Channel fabric. A new device has been connected to the Fibre Channel storage interface that was configured for port security. The port security was enabled for the VSAN that the port belongs to. Despite the configuration, the rogue devices can log into the fabric. Which action resolves the issue?

choices.C: Detach the association with the no rule command within the feature-group configuration
choices.B: Detach the association with the no role command within the feature-group configuration mode
choices.D: Detach the association with the no role command within the role configuration mode
choices.A: Detach the association with the no rule command within the role configuration mode

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A network administrator must delete a feature group from a Cisco Nexus 5000 Series Switch. Which action resolves the issue?

discussion.content:
CLI rejects feature-group removal
The CLI rejects the no role feature-group name <group-name> command when the administrator tries to delete a feature-group.

Possible Cause

A CLI error indicates that the feature group is in use, which means that it is included in one of the role configurations.

Solution

To address the error, perform the following steps:

Use the show role | egrep role:|feature-group command to display which feature group is associated with the role or under which role.
Detach the association with the no rule command within the role configuration mode, and then delete the feature group.

Selected Answer: C
Should be C

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer discovers that if the vPC peer link goes down, half of the devices in VLAN 20 experience connectivity issues with the external networks Which action resolves the issue?

choices.D: Exclude the non-vPC VLANs from vPC peer link
choices.C: Add the non-vPC SVIs in the dual-active exclude VLAN list
choices.B: Allow non-vPC VLANs on a second trunk between the two vPC peers
choices.A: Configure a dedicated Layer 3 link between vPC peers
Enable BGP advertise pip feature on both leaf switches
choices.C: Classify CFS messages for strict priority queue on spine switches
choices.D: Change all ports on spine switches as port-type fabric
choices.B: Configure the same source IP address on NVE and virtual peer link on leaf switches

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer is troubleshooting the connectivity between Server-1 and Server-2. Which action resolves the connectivity issue?

An FSM failed during an upgrade with the auto-install feature enabled. The engineer must remove the service pack from the subordinate fabric interconnect (FI) to recover the FIs. Which set of commands resolves the issue?

choices.B:
UCS-A# scope org -
UCS-A /org # scope fw-infra-pack default
UCS-A /org/fw-infra-pack # set infra-bundle-version ""
UCS-A /org/fw-infra-pack* # commit-buffer
choices.D:
UCS-A# scope fabric-interconnect b
UCS-A# /fabric-interconnect # remove service-pack
UCS-A# /fabric-interconnect* # commit-buffer
choices.A:
UCS-A# scope fabric-interconnect b
UCS-A# /fabric-interconnect # remove service-pack security
UCS-A# /fabric-interconnect* # commit-buffer
choices.C:
UCS-A# scope org -
UCS-A /org # scope fw-infra-pack default
UCS-A /org/fw-infra-pack # set infra-bundle-version ""
UCS-A# /fabric-interconnect # remove service-pack security
UCS-A# /fabric-interconnect* # commit-buffer
